title: Watch full remarks as Biden, Zelenskyy unite in support of Ukraine
description: Presidents Biden and Zelenskyy held a joint press conference at the White House, the Ukrainian president's first known trip outside of his country since Russia invaded over nine months ago. Biden reassured Zelenskyy that the U.S. will stand with Ukraine in its continued fight against Russia, and Zelenskyy offers thanks to Americans, describing the U.S. and Ukraine "real partners."

title: Israel’s Netanyahu says he has formed new government
description: Designated Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced late Wednesday that he has successfully formed a new coalition, setting the stage for him to return to

title: Patriot missile battery for Ukraine ‘not escalatory’ but 'defensive,' says Biden
description: President Joe Biden said the Patriot missile battery system is “not escalatory,” when asked about whether the U.S. has made an "escalatory assessment" by agreeing to send it to Ukraine. Biden called it “defensive” and said he would “love for them not to use it.”

title: Zelenskyy says Putin lied at 2019 Normandy meeting saying full-scale invasion 'won't happen'
description: At a joint press conference with President Biden, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy indicated that in 2019 Ukraine sent Russian President Vladimir Putin messages to ensure there would not be a full-scale invasion. Zelenskyy added that Putin said at the time an invasion on Ukraine "won't happen."

title: Biden: U.S. committed to ensuring Ukrainian people can continue to defend their country
description: In a joint press conference with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, President Biden expresses his support for Ukraine by emphasizing the need to pass the spending bill to provide more assistance, saying "Russia is using winter as a weapon." Biden concluded his remarks stating, "the U.S. is committed to ensuring Ukrainian people can continue to defend their country."

title: Zelenskyy’s trip to U.S. allows him to directly reach Americans
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy traveled to the U.S. in a trip to meet with President Joe Biden and address Congress. Zelenskyy may use the opportunity to request aid and thank the American people for the assistance they have given thus far.

title: Zelenskyy arrives at the White House for a meeting with Biden in a push for Ukraine aid
description: Zelenskyy to visit the White House to meet with Biden, will address Congress

title: Putin calls Ukraine conflict 'tragedy,' vows to keep fighting
description: Russia’s Vladimir Putin called the conflict in Ukraine a “common tragedy” but vowed to send more troops into battle. Speaking at a meeting with his top military brass, the leader says that what is happening in Ukraine is “not a result” of Russia’s policy, but rather policies of Western nations which are bent on toppling the former soviet state.

title: Putin vows to win in Ukraine as Russian military to reach 1.5 million
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin described the fighting in Ukraine as a “tragedy” but vowed to pursue his campaign there until its goals are reached Wednesday,

title: Peru orders Mexico’s ambassador to leave country in latest escalation of tensions
description: Peru declared Mexico’s ambassador to Lima “persona non grata” and ordered him to leave the country on Tuesday, Peru’s foreign minister announced, in the latest

title: Watch: Toronto police say eight teen girls charged with stabbing death of 59-year-old man
description: Toronto police announced that eight teenage girls have been charged with second-degree murder in Canada in the stabbing death of a 59-year-old man. Detective Sergeant Terry Browne told reporters the three 13-year-olds, three 14-year-olds and two 16-year-olds met through social media.

title: Protests, dismay follow Taliban ban on women's higher education
description: Protests outside a university in Jalalabad greeted the Taliban's ban on higher education for women in Afghanistan. In Kabul, one student said she cried when she heard the news that she would be barred from class.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu faces deadline to form new Israeli government
description: Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to form a new coalition government in Israel after the country’s fifth elections in less than four years, partnering up with religious and ultranationalist groups. President of the Global Situation Room and former director of global engagement for the Obama White House, Brett Bruen, joins News NOW to explain how Netanyahu’s new government could impact peace prospects in the region and what it could mean for the future of a Palestinian state.

title: Female students turned away as Taliban fighters enforce university ban
description: Taliban security forces in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Wednesday enforced a higher education ban for women by blocking their access to universities.

title: 8 teenage girls charged with murder in deadly stabbing attack on 59-year-old man in Canada
description: Eight teenage girls have been charged with murder in Canada in the stabbing death of a 59-year-old man in what police are describing as a "swarming" attack.

title: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to meet Biden, address Congress
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is set to meet with President Biden and address Congress in Washington in his first known trip outside of Ukraine since Russia invaded in February. NBC News’ Carol Lee explains what to expect from Zelenskyy’s trip to the U.S.

title: Watch: Ukraine's Zelenskyy seen in Poland heading to U.S.
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was seen at a train station in the southern Polish city of Przemysl on his way to the U.S. on Wednesday, in video from private broadcaster TVN.

title: Zelenskyy heads to U.S. as Ukraine warns Putin plans a major new offensive
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will meet with Biden and Congress as Ukraine warns that Russia's military is planning a major winter ground offensive.

title: Belarus, Russia hold drills for 'combat coordination,' ministries say
description: Russian and Belarusian forces continued their joint military drills in Belarus, the defense ministries of both countries reported on Wednesday. Video released by the Belarusian Defense Ministry showed tanks firing missiles, troops training in mock house interiors and armored vehicles driving through woodland.

title: Video shows moment Argentina soccer fans jump onto team bus
description: Argentina's World Cup winning celebrations were curtailed amid security concerns after millions gathered to welcome the soccer team home.

title: Hearses line up at Beijing crematorium, even as China reports no new Covid deaths
description: Dozens of hearses lined up outside a Beijing crematorium on Wednesday, even as China reported no new Covid-19 deaths in its growing outbreak.

title: Argentina’s World Cup heroes airlifted in helicopters as street party overflows
description: Argentina’s World Cup winners had to abandon an open-top bus parade in Buenos Aires on Tuesday as millions of ecstatic fans flooded onto the streets.

title: Zelenskyy to meet with Biden and Congress in D.C.
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will meet with President Joe Biden and deliver an address to members of Congress during a visit to Washington, D.C.

title: Scorched: East Africa’s Climate Crisis
description: East Africa is ground zero for climate change. In Kenya where community leaders tell NBC News Chief International Correspondent Keir Simmons of fertile lands just a decade ago that now looked to me a lot like dessert. These are not the people who caused climate change, yet they are suffering from global warming that has nothing to do with them. But it’s not just climate - conflict around the world is also driving food insecurity. “Scorched: East Africa’s Climate Crisis” looks at the glob

title: Mike Hodges, British director behind gangster classic 'Get Carter,' dies at 90
description: Mike Hodges, the British filmmaker who directed the hard-boiled gangster saga "Get Carter" and the campy space opera "Flash Gordon," died Saturday.

title: Injured Iranian protesters turn to social media for medical treatment
description: As protests in Iran enter their third month, injured protestors are turning to social media to receive medical treatment as some doctors are claiming many of the wounded cannot seek care at local hospitals over fears they will be reported to authorities. NBC News’ Maura Barrett reports on how one U.S.-based physician is providing care from thousands of miles away. Warning some of the following images may be difficult to see.
